item.title: September 2011 flooding on the Susquehanna River basin after Tropical Storm Lee
item.description: The remnants of Tropical Storm Lee have made their way slowly from the Gulf of Mexico to the northeastern United States, bringing a storm with a slow-moving heavy rain. There is widespread flooding in the Susquehanna River basin and flash floods across the area. The Weather Underground's Jeff Masters has commentary on the storm from the morning of September 8, 2011, saying An extreme rainfall event unprecedented in recorded history has hit the Binghamton, New York area, where 7.
